trans-unit.source: Endpoint configuration is split into two categories. Compile-time configuration means the configuration is read during compilation and changing it at runtime has no effect. The compile-time configuration is mostly related to error handling and instrumentation.

trans-unit.source: Every time the fetch callback is invoked, it is done from a separate process. Given those processes run asynchronously, it is often necessary to guarantee they have been shutdown at the end of every test. This can be done by using ExUnit's on_exit hook plus fetchers_pids function:

Every time you join a channel, you need to choose which particular topic you want to listen to. The topic is just an identifier, but by convention it is often made of two parts: "topic:subtopic". Using the "topic:subtopic" approach pairs nicely with the Phoenix.Socket.channel/2 allowing you to match on all topics starting with a given prefix:
trans-unit.target: Cada vez que te unes a un canal, debes elegir qué tema en particular quieres escuchar. El tema es solo un identificador, pero por convención a menudo se compone de dos partes: "topic:subtopic" . El uso del enfoque "topic:subtopic" se combina muy bien con Phoenix.Socket.channel/2 , lo que le permite hacer coincidir todos los temas que comienzan con un prefijo determinado:

trans-unit.source: Every time you join a channel, you need to choose which particular topic you want to listen to. The topic is just an identifier, but by convention it is often made of two parts: "topic:subtopic". Using the "topic:subtopic" approach pairs nicely with the Phoenix.Socket.channel/3 allowing you to match on all topics starting with a given prefix by using a splat (the * character) as the last character in the topic pattern:

trans-unit.source: Except expression returns only unique rows as if each query returned distinct results. This may cause performance penalty. If you need just to take the difference of multiple result sets without removing duplicate rows consider using except_all/2.
trans-unit.target: Excepto que la expresión devuelve solo filas únicas como si cada consulta arrojara resultados distintos. Esto puede causar una penalización del rendimiento. Si solo necesita tomar la diferencia de varios conjuntos de resultados sin eliminar filas duplicadas, considere usar except_all/2 .

trans-unit.source: For has_many :through - it behaves similarly to a regular has_many but note that the IDs received are of the last association. Imagine for example a post has many comments and each comment has an author. Therefore, a post may have many comments_authors, written as has_many :comments_authors, through: [:comments, :author]. When preloading authors with a custom function via :comments_authors, the function will receive the IDs of the authors as the last step

For has_many :through - it behaves similarly to a regular has_many but note that the IDs received are the ones from the closest parent and not the furthest one. Imagine for example a post has many comments and each comment has an author. Therefore, a post may have many comments_authors, written as has_many :comments_authors, through: [:comments, :author]. When preloading authors with a custom function via :comments_authors, the function will receive the IDs of the comments and not of the posts. That’s because through associations are still loaded step by step
trans-unit.target: Para has_many :through : se comporta de manera similar a un has_many normal, pero tenga en cuenta que los ID recibidos son los del padre más cercano y no el más lejano. Imagine, por ejemplo, que una publicación tiene muchos comentarios y cada comentario tiene un autor. Por lo tanto, una publicación puede tener muchos comments_authors, escritos como has_many :comments_authors, through: [:comments, :author] . Al precargar autores con una función personalizada a través de :comments_authors , la función recibirá los ID de los comentarios y no de las publicaciones. Eso es porque a través de asociaciones todavía se cargan paso a paso

trans-unit.source: For has_many and belongs_to - the function receives the IDs of the parent association and it must return a list of maps or structs with the associated entries. The associated map/struct must contain the "foreign_key" field. For example, if a post has many comments, when preloading the comments with a custom function, the function will receive a list of "post_ids" as argument and it must return maps or structs representing the comments. The maps/structs must include the :post_id field

For has_many and belongs_to - the function receives the IDs of the parent association and it must return a list of maps or structs with the associated entries. The associated map/struct must contain the “foreign_key” field. For example, if a post has many comments, when preloading the comments with a custom function, the function will receive a list of “post_ids” as argument and it must return maps or structs representing the comments. The maps/structs must include the :post_id field
trans-unit.target: Para has_many y belongs_to : la función recibe los ID de la asociación principal y debe devolver una lista de mapas o estructuras con las entradas asociadas. El mapa / estructura asociado debe contener el campo "Foreign_key". Por ejemplo, si una publicación tiene muchos comentarios, al precargar los comentarios con una función personalizada, la función recibirá una lista de "post_ids" como argumento y debe devolver mapas o estructuras que representen los comentarios. Los mapas / estructuras deben incluir el campo :post_id

trans-unit.source: For many_to_many - the function receives the IDs of the parent association and it must return a tuple with the parent id as first element and the association map or struct as second. For example, if a post has many tags, when preloading the tags with a custom function, the function will receive a list of "post_ids" as argument and it must return a tuple in the format of {post_id, tag}

For many_to_many - the function receives the IDs of the parent association and it must return a tuple with the parent id as first element and the association map or struct as second. For example, if a post has many tags, when preloading the tags with a custom function, the function will receive a list of “post_ids” as argument and it must return a tuple in the format of {post_id, tag}
trans-unit.target: Para many_to_many : la función recibe los ID de la asociación principal y debe devolver una tupla con la identificación principal como primer elemento y el mapa de asociación o estructura como segundo. Por ejemplo, si una publicación tiene muchas etiquetas, al precargar las etiquetas con una función personalizada, la función recibirá una lista de "post_ids" como argumento y debe devolver una tupla con el formato {post_id, tag}

For a given topic, the client may only establish a single channel subscription. When attempting to create a duplicate subscription, dispatch/3 will close the existing channel, log a warning, and spawn a new channel for the topic. When sending the "phx_close" event from the closed channel, the message will contain the ref the client sent when joining. This allows the client to uniquely identify "phx_close" and "phx_error" messages when force-closing a channel on duplicate joins.
trans-unit.target: Para un tema determinado, el cliente solo puede establecer una suscripción de un solo canal. Al intentar crear una suscripción duplicada, dispatch/3 cerrará el canal existente, registrará una advertencia y generará un nuevo canal para el tema. Al enviar el evento "phx_close" desde el canal cerrado, el mensaje contendrá la ref erencia que envió el cliente al unirse. Esto permite al cliente identificar de forma única los "phx_close" y "phx_error" cuando se fuerza el cierre de un canal en combinaciones duplicadas.

For calendar types with and without microseconds, the precision is enforced when persisting to the DB. For example, casting ~T[09:00:00] as :time_usec will succeed and result in ~T[09:00:00.000000], but persisting a type without microseconds as :time_usec will fail. Similarly, casting ~T[09:00:00.000000] as :time will succeed, but persisting will not. This is the same behaviour as seen in other types, where casting has to be done explicitly and is never performed implicitly when loading from or dumping to the database.
trans-unit.target: Para los tipos de calendario con y sin microsegundos, la precisión se aplica cuando se persiste en la base de datos. Por ejemplo, la conversión de ~T[09:00:00] como :time_usec tendrá éxito y dará como resultado ~T[09:00:00.000000] , pero la persistencia de un tipo sin microsegundos como :time_usec fallará. De manera similar, la conversión de ~T[09:00:00.000000] como :time tendrá éxito, pero la persistencia no. Este es el mismo comportamiento que se ve en otros tipos, donde la conversión debe realizarse explícitamente y nunca se realiza implícitamente al cargar o volcar a la base de datos.

trans-unit.source: For each request, Phoenix goes through all modules and checks if any of them implement a __phoenix_recompile__?/0 function. If they do and it returns true, the module source file is touched, forcing it to be recompiled. For this functionality to work, Phoenix requires you to add the :phoenix compiler to your list of compilers:

trans-unit.source: For example, PostgreSQL will store embeds on top of JSONB columns, which means types in embedded schemas won’t go through the usual dump->DB->load cycle but rather encode->DB->decode->cast. This means that, when using embedded schemas with databases like PG or MySQL, make sure all of your types can be JSON encoded/decoded correctly. Ecto provides this guarantee for all built-in types.
trans-unit.target: Por ejemplo, PostgreSQL almacenará incrustaciones en la parte superior de las columnas JSONB, lo que significa que los tipos en esquemas incrustados no pasarán por el ciclo habitual de volcado-> DB-> carga, sino codificar-> DB-> decodificar-> emitir. Esto significa que, cuando utilice esquemas integrados con bases de datos como PG o MySQL, asegúrese de que todos sus tipos puedan codificarse / descodificarse JSON correctamente. Ecto ofrece esta garantía para todos los modelos integrados.

trans-unit.source: For example, PostgreSQL will store embeds on top of JSONB columns, which means types in embedded schemas won't go through the usual dump->DB->load cycle but rather encode->DB->decode->cast. This means that, when using embedded schemas with databases like PG or MySQL, make sure all of your types can be JSON encoded/decoded correctly. Ecto provides this guarantee for all built-in types.

For example, if :on_conflict is set to :nothing, Postgres will return 0 if no new entry was added while MySQL will still return the amount of entries attempted to be inserted, even if no entry was added. Even worse, if :on_conflict is query, MySQL will return the number of attempted entries plus the number of entries modified by the UPDATE query.
trans-unit.target: Por ejemplo, si :on_conflict se establece en :nothing , Postgres devolverá 0 si no se agregó ninguna entrada nueva, mientras que MySQL aún devolverá la cantidad de entradas que se intentó insertar, incluso si no se agregó ninguna entrada. Peor aún, si :on_conflict es consulta, MySQL devolverá el número de entradas intentadas más el número de entradas modificadas por la consulta UPDATE.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you are running your application behind a proxy, the browser will send a request to the proxy with www.example.com but the proxy will request you using an internal IP. In such cases, it is common for proxies to attach information such as "x-forwarded-host" that contains the original host. This may also happen on redirects. If you have a POST request tofoo.example.comthat redirects with statusbar.example.comwith status 407. The token and the server will be running on different versions. You can pass the:allow_hostsoption to control any host that you may want to allow. The values in:allow_hostsmay either be a full host name or a host suffix. For example:[“www.example.com”, “.subdomain.example.com”]will allow the exact host of”www.example.com”and any host that ends with”.subdomain.example.com”. ## Options *:session_key- the name of the key in session to store the token under *:allow_hosts- a list with hosts to allow on cross-host tokens *:with- should be one of:exceptionor:clear_session. Defaults to:exception. *:exception- for invalid requests, this plug will raise [Plug.CSRFProtection.InvalidCSRFTokenError](Plug.CSRFProtection.InvalidCSRFTokenError.html). *:clear_session- for invalid requests, this plug will set an empty session for only this request. Also any changes to the session during this request will be ignored. ## Disabling You may disable this plug by doingPlug.Conn.put_private(conn, :plug_skip_csrf_protection, true). This was made available for disabling [Plug.CSRFProtection](Plug.CSRFProtection.html#content) in tests and not for dynamically skipping [Plug.CSRFProtection](Plug.CSRFProtection.html#content) in production code. If you want specific routes to skip [Plug.CSRFProtection](Plug.CSRFProtection.html#content), then use a different stack of plugs for that route that does not include [Plug.CSRFProtection`](Plug.CSRFProtection.html#content). ## Examples plug Plug.Session, … plug :fetch_session plug Plug.CSRFProtection

You can pass the option to control any host that you may want to allow. The values in : allow_hosts para controlar cualquier host que desee permitir. Los valores en : allow_hosts may either be a full host name or a host suffix. trans-unit.source: For this plug to work, it expects a session to have been previously fetched. It will then compare the plug stored in the session with the one sent by the request to determine the validity of the request. For an invalid request the action taken is based on the :with option.

Luego comparará el complemento almacenado en la sesión con el enviado por la solicitud para determinar la validez de la solicitud. Para una solicitud no válida, la acción tomada se basa en la opción :with .

trans-unit.source: For this plug to work, it expects a session to have been previously fetched. It will then compare the token stored in the session with the one sent by the request to determine the validity of the request. For an invalid request the action taken is based on the :with option.

Luego comparará el token almacenado en la sesión con el enviado por la solicitud para determinar la validez de la solicitud. Para una solicitud no válida, la acción tomada se basa en la opción :with .

Furthermore, since the tag information is given as structs read directly from the database, Ecto will treat the data as correct and only do the minimum necessary to guarantee that posts and tags are associated, without trying to update or diff any of the fields in the tag struct.
trans-unit.target: Además,como la información de la etiqueta se da como estructuras leídas directamente de la base de datos,Ecto tratará los datos como correctos y sólo hará lo mínimo necesario para garantizar que los postes y las etiquetas se asocien,sin intentar actualizar o diferenciar ninguno de los campos de la estructura de la etiqueta.

trans-unit.source: Furthermore, the before_send field stores callbacks that are invoked before the connection is sent. Callbacks are invoked in the reverse order they are registered (callbacks registered first are invoked last) in order to reproduce a pipeline ordering.
trans-unit.target: Además, el campo before_send almacena devoluciones de llamada que se invocan antes de que se envíe la conexión. Las devoluciones de llamada se invocan en el orden inverso en el que se registran (las devoluciones de llamada registradas primero se invocan al final) para reproducir un orden de canalización.

trans-unit.source: Furthermore, this protocol relies on iodata, which provides better performance when sending or streaming data to the client.
trans-unit.target: Además,este protocolo se basa en los yodatos,que proporcionan un mejor rendimiento al enviar o transmitir datos al cliente.

trans-unit.source: GET requests are not protected, as they should not have any side-effect or change your application state. JavaScript requests are an exception: by using a script tag, external websites can embed server-side generated JavaScript, which can leak information. For this reason, this plug also forbids any GET JavaScript request that is not XHR (or AJAX).
trans-unit.target: Las solicitudes de GET no están protegidas,ya que no deberían tener ningún efecto secundario ni cambiar el estado de su solicitud.Las solicitudes de JavaScript son una excepción:mediante el uso de una etiqueta de script,los sitios web externos pueden incrustar JavaScript generado por el lado del servidor,que puede filtrar información.Por esta razón,este plugin también prohíbe cualquier petición GET JavaScript que no sea XHR (o AJAX).

trans-unit.source: Groups are also supported:

Groups together rows from the schema that have the same values in the given fields. Using group_by "groups" the query giving it different semantics in the select expression. If a query is grouped, only fields that were referenced in the group_by can be used in the select or if the field is given as an argument to an aggregate function.

Groups together rows from the schema that have the same values in the given fields. Using group_by “groups” the query giving it different semantics in the select expression. If a query is grouped, only fields that were referenced in the group_by can be used in the select or if the field is given as an argument to an aggregate function.
trans-unit.target: Agrupa filas del esquema que tienen los mismos valores en los campos dados. Usando group_by “grupos” la consulta le da una semántica diferente en la expresión de select . Si una consulta está agrupada, solo los campos a los que se hizo referencia en group_by se pueden usar en la select o si el campo se proporciona como un argumento para una función agregada.

However, Plug.Static also supports direct cache control by using versioned query strings. If the request query string starts with "?vsn=", Plug.Static assumes the application is versioning assets and does not set the ETag header, meaning the cache behaviour will be specified solely by the cache_control_for_vsn_requests config, which defaults to "public, max-age=31536000".

However, Plug.Static also supports direct cache control by using versioned query strings. If the request query string starts with “?vsn=”, Plug.Static assumes the application is versioning assets and does not set the ETag header, meaning the cache behaviour will be specified solely by the cache_control_for_vsn_requests config, which defaults to "public, max-age=31536000".
trans-unit.target: Sin embargo, Plug.Static también admite el control directo de la caché mediante el uso de cadenas de consulta versionadas. Si la cadena de consulta de solicitud comienza con "? Vsn =", Plug.Static asume que la aplicación está versionando activos y no establece el encabezado ETag , lo que significa que el comportamiento de la caché será especificado únicamente por la configuración cache_control_for_vsn_requests , que por defecto es "public, max-age=31536000" .

trans-unit.source: If transaction/2 is called inside another transaction, the function is simply executed, without wrapping the new transaction call in any way. If there is an error in the inner transaction and the error is rescued, or the inner transaction is rolled back, the whole outer transaction is marked as tainted, guaranteeing nothing will be committed.
trans-unit.target: Si se llama a la transaction/2 dentro de otra transacción, la función simplemente se ejecuta, sin envolver la nueva llamada de transacción de ninguna manera. Si hay un error en la transacción interna y el error se rescata, o la transacción interna se revierte, toda la transacción externa se marca como contaminada, lo que garantiza que no se cometerá nada.

If {:cache, cache_function, prepared} is given, it means the query can be cached and it must be cached by calling the cache_function function with the cache entry of your choice. Once cache_function is called, the next time the same query is given to execute/5, it will receive the :cached tuple.

If {:cached, update_function, reset_function, cached} is given, it means the query has been cached. You may call update_function/1 if you want to update the cached result. Or you may call reset_function/1, with a new prepared query, to force the query to be cached again. If reset_function/1 is called, the next time the same query is given to execute/5, it will receive the :cache tuple.
If {:nocache, prepared} is given, it means the query was not and cannot be cached. The prepared value is the value returned by prepare/2.

trans-unit.source: If a field is given to validate_required/3 but it has not been passed as parameter during cast/3 (i.e. it has not been changed), then validate_required/3 will check for its current value in the data. If the data contains an non-empty value for the field, then no error is added. This allows developers to use validate_required/3 to perform partial updates. For example, on insert all fields would be required, because their default values on the data are all nil, but on update, if you don't want to change a field that has been previously set, you are not required to pass it as a paramater, since validate_required/3 won't add an error for missing changes as long as the value in the data given to the changeset is not empty.

If a file is uploaded via any of the parsers, Plug will stream the uploaded contents to a file in a temporary directory in order to avoid loading the whole file into memory. For such, the :plug application needs to be started in order for file uploads to work. More details on how the uploaded file is handled can be found in the documentation for Plug.Upload.
trans-unit.target: Si se carga un archivo a través de cualquiera de los analizadores, Plug transmitirá el contenido cargado a un archivo en un directorio temporal para evitar cargar todo el archivo en la memoria. Para ello, es necesario iniciar la aplicación :plug para que la carga de archivos funcione. Puede encontrar más detalles sobre cómo se maneja el archivo cargado en la documentación de Plug.Upload .

trans-unit.source: If a request id already exists as the "x-request-id" HTTP request header, then that value will be used assuming it is between 20 and 200 characters. If it is not, a new request id will be generated.
If a request id already exists as the “x-request-id” HTTP request header, then that value will be used assuming it is between 20 and 200 characters. If it is not, a new request id will be generated.
trans-unit.target: Si ya existe un ID de solicitud como el encabezado de solicitud HTTP "x-request-id", ese valor se utilizará asumiendo que tiene entre 20 y 200 caracteres. Si no es así, se generará un nuevo ID de solicitud.

trans-unit.source: If an unhandled error occurs the transaction will be rolled back and the error will bubble up from the transaction function. If no error occurred the transaction will be committed when the function returns. A transaction can be explicitly rolled back by calling rollback/1, this will immediately leave the function and return the value given to rollback as {:error, value}.
trans-unit.target: Si ocurre un error no manejado, la transacción se revertirá y el error brotará de la función de transacción. Si no ocurrió ningún error, la transacción se confirmará cuando la función regrese. Una transacción se puede revertir explícitamente llamando a rollback/1 , esto dejará inmediatamente la función y devolverá el valor dado para rollback como {:error, value} .

trans-unit.source: If any of the callbacks return a :stop tuple, it will also trigger terminate with the reason given in the tuple.
trans-unit.target: Si alguna de las devoluciones de llamada devuelve una tupla :stop , también activará la terminación con el motivo dado en la tupla.

trans-unit.target: Si el casting de todos los campos tiene éxito,el conjunto de cambios se devuelve como válido.

trans-unit.source: If it is a keyword query the first argument must be either an in expression, or a value that implements the Ecto.Queryable protocol. If the query needs a reference to the data source in any other part of the expression, then an in must be used to create a reference variable. The second argument should be a keyword query where the keys are expression types and the values are expressions.
trans-unit.target: Si es una consulta por palabra clave, el primer argumento debe ser una expresión in o un valor que implemente el protocolo Ecto.Queryable . Si la consulta necesita una referencia a la fuente de datos en cualquier otra parte de la expresión, a continuación, una in debe ser utilizado para crear una variable de referencia. El segundo argumento debe ser una consulta de palabras clave donde las claves son tipos de expresión y los valores son expresiones.

trans-unit.source: If multi contains operations that accept changesets (like insert/4, update/4 or delete/4) they will be checked before starting the transaction. If any changeset has errors, the transaction won’t even be started and the error will be immediately returned.
trans-unit.target: Si contiene múltiples operaciones que aceptan conjuntos de cambios (como insert/4 , update/4 o delete/4 ), se comprobarán antes de iniciar la transacción. Si algún conjunto de cambios tiene errores, la transacción ni siquiera se iniciará y el error se devolverá de inmediato.

trans-unit.source: If the adapter provides a pool, it is supposed to "check out" one of the pool connections for the duration of the function call. Which connection is checked out is not passed to the calling function, so it should be done using a stateful method like using the current process' dictionary, process tracking, or some kind of other lookup method. Make sure that this stored connection is then used in the other callbacks implementations, such as Ecto.Adapter.Queryable and Ecto.Adapter.Schema.

trans-unit.source: If you are sending data to a full URI, such as //subdomain.host.com/path or //external.com/path, instead of a simple path such as /path, you may want to consider using get_csrf_token_for/1, as that will encode the host in the CSRF token. Once received, Plug will only consider the CSRF token to be valid if the host encoded in the token is the same as the one in conn.host.
trans-unit.target: Si está enviando datos a un URI completo, como //subdomain.host.com/path o //external.com/path , en lugar de una ruta simple como /path , puede considerar usar get_csrf_token_for/1 , ya que codificará el host en el token CSRF. Una vez recibido, Plug solo considerará que el token CSRF es válido si el host codificado en el token es el mismo que el de conn.host .

trans-unit.source: If you are trying to debug transaction-related code while using Ecto.Adapters.SQL.Sandbox, it may be more helpful to configure the database to log all statements and consult those logs.
trans-unit.target: Si está intentando depurar código relacionado con transacciones mientras usa Ecto.Adapters.SQL.Sandbox , puede ser más útil configurar la base de datos para registrar todas las declaraciones y consultar esos registros.

trans-unit.source: If you are using the Ecto.Adapters.SQL.Sandbox in tests, note that even though each test is inside a transaction, in_transaction?/0 will only return true inside transactions explicitly created with transaction/2. This is done so the test environment mimics dev and prod.
trans-unit.target: Si está utilizando Ecto.Adapters.SQL.Sandbox en las pruebas, tenga en cuenta que aunque cada prueba está dentro de una transacción, in_transaction?/0 solo devolverá verdadero dentro de las transacciones creadas explícitamente con la transaction/2 . Esto se hace para que el entorno de prueba imite a dev y prod.

trans-unit.source: If you attempt to remove associated many_to_many data, Ecto will always remove data from the join schema and never from the target associations be it by setting :on_replace to :delete, :on_delete to :delete_all or by using changeset functions such as Ecto.Changeset.put_assoc/3. For example, if a Post has a many to many relationship with Tag, setting :on_delete to :delete_all will only delete entries from the "posts_tags" table in case Post is deleted.

If you attempt to remove associated many_to_many data, Ecto will always remove data from the join schema and never from the target associations be it by setting :on_replace to :delete, :on_delete to :delete_all or by using changeset functions such as Ecto.Changeset.put_assoc/3. For example, if a Post has a many to many relationship with Tag, setting :on_delete to :delete_all will only delete entries from the “posts_tags” table in case Post is deleted.
trans-unit.target: Si intenta quitar asociados many_to_many datos, Ecto siempre será eliminar los datos de la unión de esquema y nunca de las asociaciones de destino ya sea por configuración :on_replace a :delete , :on_delete a :delete_all o mediante el uso de las funciones del conjunto de cambios como Ecto.Changeset.put_assoc/3 . Por ejemplo, si una Post tiene una relación de varios a muchos con la Tag , configurar :on_delete a :delete_all solo eliminará las entradas de la tabla "posts_tags" en caso de que se elimine la Post .

trans-unit.source: In the example above, instead of issuing a separate query to fetch comments, Ecto will fetch posts and comments in a single query and then do a separate pass associating each comment to its parent post. Therefore, instead of returning number_of_posts * number_of_comments results, like a join would, it returns only posts with the comments fields properly filled in.
trans-unit.target: En el ejemplo anterior, en lugar de emitir una consulta separada para obtener comentarios, Ecto buscará publicaciones y comentarios en una sola consulta y luego hará una pasada separada asociando cada comentario a su publicación principal. Por lo tanto, en lugar de devolver number_of_posts * number_of_comments resultados, como lo haría una join , solo devuelve publicaciones con los campos de comments debidamente completados.

trans-unit.target: En el ejemplo anterior, la información de presencia actual para el tema del socket se envía al cliente como un evento de "presence_state" . A continuación, Presence.track se utiliza para registrar el proceso de este canal como presencia para el ID de usuario del socket, con un mapa de metadatos.

trans-unit.source: In the example above, we have defined a has_many :through association named :comments_authors. A :through association always expects a list and the first element of the list must be a previously defined association in the current module. For example, :comments_authors first points to :comments in the same module (Post), which then points to :author in the next schema, Comment.
trans-unit.target: En el ejemplo anterior, hemos definido una has_many :through llamada :comments_authors . R :through asociación siempre se espera una lista y el primer elemento de la lista debe ser una asociación previamente definida en el módulo actual. Por ejemplo :comments_authors primero apunta a :comments en el mismo módulo (Publicación), que luego apunta a :author en el siguiente esquema, Comment .

trans-unit.source: In the examples above, even though it returned :ok, we do not know if we inserted new data or if we updated only the :on_conflict fields. In case an update happened, the data in the struct most likely does not match the data in the database. For example, autogenerated fields such as inserted_at will point to now rather than the time the struct was actually inserted.
trans-unit.target: En los ejemplos anteriores, aunque devolvió :ok , no sabemos si :on_conflict nuevos datos o si actualizamos solo los campos : on_conflict . En caso de que ocurriera una actualización, lo más probable es que los datos de la estructura no coincidan con los datos de la base de datos. Por ejemplo, los campos generados automáticamente como inserted_at apuntarán a ahora en lugar de a la hora en que se insertó realmente la estructura.

trans-unit.source: In this example, we prepend the new comment to the list of existing comments. Ecto will diff the list of comments currently in post with the list of comments given, and correctly insert the new comment to the database. Note, however, Ecto is doing a lot of work just to figure out something we knew since the beginning, which is that there is only one new comment.
trans-unit.target: En este ejemplo, anteponemos el nuevo comentario a la lista de comentarios existentes. Ecto diferenciará la lista de comentarios actualmente en post con la lista de comentarios proporcionada e insertará correctamente el nuevo comentario en la base de datos. Sin embargo, tenga en cuenta que Ecto está trabajando mucho solo para descubrir algo que sabíamos desde el principio, que es que solo hay un comentario nuevo.

trans-unit.target: No es posible configurar directamente el puerto en Plug.SSL porque HSTS espera que el puerto sea 443 para SSL. Si no está utilizando HSTS y desea redirigir a HTTPS en otro puerto, puede colarse junto con el host, por ejemplo: host: "example.com:443" .

trans-unit.source: It is recommended for header keys to be in lowercase, to avoid sending duplicate keys in a request. Additionally, responses with mixed-case headers served over HTTP/2 are not considered valid by common clients, resulting in dropped responses. As a convenience, when using the Plug.Adapters.Conn.Test adapter, any headers that aren't lowercase will raise a Plug.Conn.InvalidHeaderError.

Keep in mind that we advise the map keys to be strings or integers instead of atoms. Atoms may be accepted depending on how maps are serialized but the database will always convert atom keys to strings due to security reasons.
trans-unit.target: Tengan en cuenta que aconsejamos que las claves del mapa sean cadenas o enteros en lugar de átomos.Los átomos pueden ser aceptados dependiendo de cómo se serialicen los mapas,pero la base de datos siempre convertirá las claves de los átomos en cadenas por razones de seguridad.
